text: I went here to look at the exhibit on display. Multiple broken parts, mis-matched components. Feels like there wasn't much effort put into this exhibit. If you are visiting to check out the things on display I'd say you'd be disappointed.

Informative free entrance esp for cyclist! When im reaching here, its almost closed for the day. So i have not enough time to enjoy and bike exhibite and the introduction of each.

Make sure you checknout their closing time and enjoy the walk there!

The people are really friendly, they are ever ready to engaged with you if you do have any questions. Feeling welcome!

Basic Bike Maintenance Course.
Informative ! very friendly and humourous presenter.
Good real world examples and safety tips.
There were even some hands on opportunities after the 2 hours session =)

Shimano cycling world has nice exhibits of the gears and some antiques tricyles. Worth a visit.

Visiting Shimano Cycling World at the Singapore Sports Museum was an excellent experience. The booking process was seamless, and the staff was quick to respond to emails. Our guide, Ms. May, went above and beyond to accommodate our group of special needs students. She was incredibly patient, answered their questions enthusiastically, and ensured the experience was interactive and engaging. Ms. May’s dedication made our museum visit both enjoyable and educational. Highly recommended for anyone looking for an inclusive and well-organized experience!

If you are cyclist, you need to make a stop here! The best part hing there is a exhibition of some special and old bikes. It’s also possible to buy some bike parts, tools or other accessories there. Entrance is for free! It’s s fun to go there and you can combine with a nice walk around the sports arena area.
